name: Bisphenol A (BPA)
description: Endocrine disruptor linked to fertility issues and hormonal imbalances
whyHarmful: BPA can mimic estrogen in the body and disrupt normal hormone function, potentially leading to reproductive issues, developmental problems, and increased cancer risk.

name: Phthalates
description: Chemical plasticizers that disrupt hormones
whyHarmful: Linked to reproductive toxicity, endocrine disruption, and developmental issues in children.

name: PFAS (Forever Chemicals)
description: Persistent chemicals that accumulate in the body
whyHarmful: PFAS don't break down naturally and accumulate in the body, linked to cancer, liver damage, and immune system effects.

name: Perchlorate
description: Chemical that interferes with thyroid function
whyHarmful: Can disrupt thyroid hormone production, which is crucial for metabolism and development.

name: Red #40
description: Artificial food dye
whyHarmful: Linked to hyperactivity in children and potential cancer risk. May cause allergic reactions.

name: Blue #1
description: Artificial food dye
whyHarmful: May cause allergic reactions and has been linked to hyperactivity in sensitive children.

name: Blue #2
description: Artificial food dye
whyHarmful: Potential allergen and may contribute to behavioral issues in children.

name: Yellow #5
description: Artificial food dye
whyHarmful: Known allergen that can cause hives, asthma, and hyperactivity in sensitive individuals.

name: Yellow #6
description: Artificial food dye
whyHarmful: May cause allergic reactions and has been linked to hyperactivity and attention problems.

name: Caramel Coloring
description: Artificial coloring that may contain carcinogens
whyHarmful: Some types contain 4-methylimidazole, a potential carcinogen formed during manufacturing.

name: Sodium Nitrate
description: Preservative that forms carcinogenic compounds
whyHarmful: Can form nitrosamines in the body, which are potent carcinogens linked to stomach and colorectal cancers.

name: Sulfites
description: Preservatives that can cause severe allergic reactions
whyHarmful: Can trigger asthma attacks and severe allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.

name: Azodicarbonamide
description: Dough conditioner banned in many countries
whyHarmful: Breaks down into semicarbazide, a potential carcinogen. Banned in Europe and Australia.

name: Potassium Bromate
description: Flour improver that's a probable carcinogen
whyHarmful: Classified as a probable human carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer.

name: BHA (Butylated Hydroxyanisole)
description: Antioxidant preservative that's a possible carcinogen
whyHarmful: Reasonably anticipated to be a human carcinogen by the National Toxicology Program.

name: BHT (Butylated Hydroxytoluene)
description: Antioxidant preservative with potential health risks
whyHarmful: May interfere with hormones and has been linked to liver and kidney damage in animal studies.

name: MSG (Monosodium Glutamate)
description: Flavor enhancer that may cause sensitivity reactions
whyHarmful: Can cause headaches, nausea, and other symptoms in sensitive individuals (MSG symptom complex).

name: High Fructose Corn Syrup
description: Highly processed sweetener linked to obesity and diabetes
whyHarmful: Associated with increased risk of obesity, diabetes, and metabolic syndrome when consumed regularly.

name: Aspartame
description: Artificial sweetener with controversial health effects
whyHarmful: May cause headaches, dizziness, and mood changes in sensitive individuals. Long-term safety debated.

name: Sucralose
description: Artificial sweetener that may affect gut health
whyHarmful: May negatively impact gut bacteria and glucose metabolism according to recent studies.

name: Canola Oil
description: Highly processed oil high in omega-6 fatty acids
whyHarmful: Highly refined processing and high omega-6 content may contribute to inflammation when consumed in excess.

name: Soybean Oil
description: Highly processed oil high in omega-6 fatty acids
whyHarmful: Often highly processed and high in omega-6 fatty acids, which may promote inflammation.

name: Corn Oil
description: Highly processed oil with poor omega fatty acid ratio
whyHarmful: High in omega-6 fatty acids and often highly processed, potentially contributing to inflammation.

name: Carrageenan
description: Seaweed extract that may cause digestive inflammation
whyHarmful: May trigger inflammatory responses in the digestive system and has been linked to gut irritation.

name: Sodium Benzoate
description: Preservative that can form benzene when combined with vitamin C
whyHarmful: Can form benzene (a known carcinogen) when combined with ascorbic acid (vitamin C) under certain conditions.

name: Propylene Glycol
description: Chemical compound used as a humectant and preservative
whyHarmful: Generally recognized as safe but may cause skin irritation and allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.
